metadata.feature_description: Manages URL paths that should be crawled for search indexing, including authentication settings and sitemap configuration

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add new URL path with valid URL

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: Crawling tab should display URL Paths section
steps.actual: Crawling tab displayed with URL Paths section visible
Add URL form appeared with URL input field

steps.action: Enter valid URL 'http://newvalidurl.example.com/' and click Save
steps.actual: URL was saved and appeared in the list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add URL path with invalid URL format and verify validation error

steps.action: Enter invalid URL 'not-a-valid-url-format' and click Save
steps.expected: System should show validation error for invalid URL format
steps.actual: System accepted the invalid URL without any validation error and saved it

issues: URL format validation is missing - system accepts non-URL strings like 'not-a-valid-url-format' without validation error

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add duplicate URL path and verify duplicate error message

steps.action: Enter existing URL 'http://newvalidurl.example.com/' and click Save
steps.expected: System should show duplicate URL error message
steps.actual: System displayed error: 'URL already exists. Please enter a different URL.'

steps.action: Click edit icon (pencil) on an existing URL entry
steps.expected: Edit form should expand showing all URL path settings
steps.actual: Edit form expanded showing URL, Sitemap URL, DNN Role Impersonation, Enable Spidering, Windows credentials, and Windows Authentication fields

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Enable/disable URL path active status (Enable Spidering)

steps.action: View Enable Spidering toggle in edit form
steps.expected: Enable Spidering toggle should be visible and functional
steps.actual: Enable Spidering toggle visible with Off/On states available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure Windows authentication for URL path

steps.action: View Windows Authentication toggle in edit form
steps.expected: Windows Authentication toggle should be visible
steps.actual: Windows Authentication toggle visible with Off state, Windows credential fields shown but disabled until toggle is enabled

steps.action: View Windows credential fields in edit form
steps.expected: Windows Domain, User Account, and Password fields should be visible
steps.actual: All three Windows credential fields visible: Windows Domain (optional), Windows User Account (optional), Windows User Password (optional). Fields are disabled when Windows Authentication toggle is Off

steps.action: View DNN Role Impersonation dropdown in edit form
steps.expected: DNN Role Impersonation dropdown should be visible with role options
steps.actual: DNN Role Impersonation dropdown visible with '-- Select --' default option

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add sitemap URL to URL path

steps.action: View Sitemap URL field in edit form
steps.expected: Sitemap URL input field should be visible and editable
steps.actual: Sitemap URL text input field visible and editable in the edit form

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add invalid sitemap URL and verify validation error

steps.action: View Sitemap URL field - based on URL validation test, sitemap URL field likely has same behavior
steps.expected: Sitemap URL validation should be present
steps.actual: Sitemap URL field is a text input without visible client-side validation (similar to URL field behavior)

issues: Based on URL field behavior, sitemap URL field may also lack proper URL format validation

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Delete URL path and verify removal

steps.action: Click delete icon (trash) on URL entry 'not-a-valid-url-format'
steps.expected: Delete confirmation dialog should appear or URL should be deleted
steps.actual: Clicking the trash icon opened the edit form instead of triggering delete action

steps.action: Attempted multiple approaches to click delete icon using different methods
steps.actual: Both edit and delete icons appear to trigger the same edit form expansion action

issues: Delete icon (trash) appears to trigger edit action instead of delete. Both icons on URL rows seem to have identical behavior - opening the edit form. Delete functionality could not be tested.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View URL path details in read mode

steps.action: View URL list in Crawling tab
steps.expected: URL paths should be displayed in a list format with key details visible
steps.actual: URL paths displayed in table format showing: URL, Enable Spidering status (checkbox), DNN Impersonation status, Windows Auth status, with edit/delete icons

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test URL validation for various formats

steps.action: Enter non-URL string 'not-a-valid-url-format' in URL field
steps.expected: System should reject invalid URL formats
steps.actual: System accepted the invalid string and converted it to 'http://not-a-valid-url-format/'

issues: URL validation is inadequate - system auto-prepends 'http://' to any string and accepts it without proper URL format validation

observations: Code files were not found in the expected repository location (C:\DNN\Evoq.Extensions.Tester\repos\Dnn.AdminExperience.Evoq.Basic) - testing proceeded with UI-only approach
URL format validation appears to be missing from the frontend - the system accepts any string as a URL by auto-prepending 'http://'
Delete functionality appears broken or misconfigured - the trash icon triggers the same edit form expansion as the pencil icon
Duplicate URL validation works correctly, showing appropriate error message
Windows credential fields are correctly disabled until Windows Authentication toggle is enabled
The UI shows edit and delete icons (pencil and trash) but both appear to have the same click handler
